$ZIM for those worried about the stock price going down.  I think you misunderstand the div.   The company is valued based on vaious factors
created_at: cash on hand being one of them.   The reduction is stock value is a reflection of the value of the cash leaving the company.   Cash reserves get rebuilt and the stock value should follow and go up.  The stock doesn't automatically get reduced in value based on a div distribution and the market determines the value.  if the company has good prospects the stock price may not go down (if often does but not always) but should come back.  Happens with almost every div issuing company.  If you buy dip after a div and then rebuilds itself as the company continues normal operations and cash gets built up and dollar-cost avg down.  Long term (as long as the company is solid) is a good plan.   Warren Buffett 101
